issues.description: The getter method for the 'name' attribute in the StockIngredient class is named 'getIngredientName()' in the template repository but 'getName()' in the solution repository. This discrepancy could confuse students who are expected to work with the template code and then compare it to the solution, as the method name change alters the structure without clear instruction in the problem statement, potentially leading to implementation errors when trying to align with the intended design.
issues.suggested_fix: Standardize the getter method name across the template and solution repositories, for example, by using 'getName()' in both to ensure consistency and avoid confusion for students implementing the class.

issues.description: The getter method for the 'name' field in the StockIngredient class is named 'getIngredientName()' in the template repository, but 'getName()' in the solution repository, while the problem statement implies a standard getter like 'getName()'. This discrepancy could confuse students who expect consistency based on the problem's description, leading to difficulties in mapping the conceptual entity (the name of the ingredient) across artifacts and potentially causing errors in implementation.
issues.suggested_fix: Update the template repository to use 'getName()' for the getter method of the 'name' field in StockIngredient.java to align with the problem statement's implied convention and the solution repository, ensuring students have a consistent naming reference across all artifacts.
